Name: Go Extinct!: Stardust Catches the Carnivores
Description:
Go Extinct! Stardust Catches the Carnivores is a new special edition of the award-winning Go Extinct! tabletop card game, incorporating artwork and concepts from the Stardust series of science books for young readers.

Players complete sets of animals based on actual genetic clades, working to collect the most sets by inferring the other player’s cards and identifying common ancestors on the evolutionary tree. By the end, players will deeply understand the amazing fact that every carnivoran alive today — from the house cat to the polar bear — descended from a single prehistoric ancestor, the miacid!

Based loosely on Go Fish, the goal is for players to collect as many sets of closely related animals as possible. The sets are "clades" of closely-related animals on the evolutionary tree board, which players use for reference. Players take turns asking another player for cards, and if they do not have a matching card, they say "Go Extinct!". The gameplay is more strategic than Go Fish because players can ask either for a specific card or a matching card at any level of the tree hierarchy, thus trading off the specificity of the result for the likelihood of a match.

Name: Dragonball Z: Lo Scontro Finale
Description:
Iconic characters from the Dragon Ball saga begin their search of power in various places (i.e. picking up power-up tokens from locations across the board), each trying to boost their own martial skill.

When a player reachs the total of 27 points between all his character's stats, he can announce a tournament! 
The others then fight in duels amongst them, trying to eliminate each other, following a matching rank based on their respective character's stats: fourth fights against third, the winner fights against second, winner gains the right to challenge the first. He who can prevail in the tournament's final, is the most powerful warrior!

From the back of the box:
"Un percorso appassionante alla conquista delle sette Sfere del Drago" 
("An epic journey conquering the seven Dragon Balls")

Name: Headless Horseman Board Game
Description:
Welcome to the Headless Horseman board game! You are Ichabod Crane racing through the haunted woods. Can you be the first player to reach the covered bridge and not be defeated and turned into a Headless Horseman?

Each player chooses a numbered movement card to play, discards that card and moves their game piece then draws a replacement movement card so they maintain 6 cards in their hand. Play rotates to the left each time with players moving their pieces along the paths through the haunted woods. At the beginning of the 4th round, each player is dealt a Curse card but players don’t look at it. As each player begins their 4th turn, in order they will turn over the Curse card to see if they have been cursed and become a Headless Horseman.

Staying in the playing order, the Headless Horseman player(s) will use their movement cards to chase down the remaining Ichabods and turn them through battle. If Ichabod runs out of hit points, they are converted to a Headless Horseman. If a horseman runs out of hit points, they are sent back to one of the graveyards and can continue the chase. Any Ichabod that reaches the covered bridge on the opposite side of the board wins, but if all players are turned to horsemen, the horsemen win.
Families: Books: The Legend of Sleepy Hollow

Name: The Alamo
Description: Knight Designs’ “The Alamo,” a 6mm miniatures playset including figures, buildings and rules.  The rules include movement, firing tables, melee, morale and painting instructions for the figures. The rules could be used with any 6mm scale Alamo game.
Families: Players: Wargames with Rules Supporting Only Two Players

Name: Pitas Pitas Palomitas
Description:
Players play city pigeons who must find the best place to feed. Fortunately, the parks with their little old men and their bags of crumbs are the best option to do it. Although the park is very large and the number of idle old people is high, so is the population of pigeons, so the players will wage a fierce battle to be the pigeon that has worn the most boots for 12 days.

You will need a great intuition and animal instinct as well as a good dose of luck to achieve it.



Los jugadores encarnan a palomas de ciudad que deben buscar el mejor lugar donde alimentarse. Afortunadamente los parques con sus viejecillos y sus bolsas de migas son la mejor opción para hacerlo. Aunque el parque es muy grande y la cantidad de viejetes ociosos alta, también lo es la población de palomas por lo que los jugadores libraran una encarnizada batalla por ser la paloma que más se ha puesto las botas durante 12 días. Necesitaras una gran intuición e instinto animal además de una buena dosis de suerte para lograrlo.

Name: 吾妻鏡 (Azuma Kagami: Yoritomo's Eastern Campaign in 1180)
Description:
Azuma Kagami (å¾å¦»é¡) is a historical chronicle: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Azuma_Kagami

This game covers the Eastern campaign of Minamoto Yoritomo (æºé ¼æœ). 
It was published to coincide with airing of NHK's The 13 Lords of the Shogun (éŽŒå€‰æ®¿ã®åä¸‰äºº).

Inspired by the Taiheiki system.
(Taiheiki, was republished by MMP named as Warriors of Japan: A Country Aflame 1335-1339).

Theme:    Conflict between the Genji and Heike clans

Number of counters:    Approx. 70 pieces
Map size:    1 half-map

Game period:    August - November 1180 (8 turns)
Scope of the game:    The whole of the Kanto region

Turn scale:    1 month per turn
Unit size:    1 warlord per unit + hundreds to thousands of warlords

Play time:    1 - 2 hours
Number of players:    2 players
Difficulty (5 levels, 5 being the highest):    1


Game Journal #79 contains three games: Azuma Kagami / Three Kingdoms Jingzhou War / Minsk 1941
Families: History: Conflicts of the Heian period – Japan
Players: Wargames with Rules Supporting Only Two Players

Name: Upshot: A Disc Golf Game
Description:
Take your disc golf game to the table with Upshot: a Disc Golf Game! A game for 1-4 players to design their own elite courses and take them to the table. What courses can you create?

Utilize each part of the game box to design your own unique course. Send your discs flying toward the hole while avoiding obstacles and hazards along the way.  You can add more obstacles to the course by using household items.

Navigate around trees and fly over water traps in this tabletop disc golf game designed for the disc golf enthusiast. As in real life, the player with the lowest score wins.

—description from the designer

Name: The Princess and the P's
Description:
The Princess is in quite a predicament—the Prince’s parents have put her to the test of pinpointing a plethora of preposterous paraphernalia planted beneath a pile of 20 poofy mattresses. If she passes the prerequisite, she’ll gain the Prince’s proposal, bringing peace and prosperity to the province. But how could anyone perceive such puny protuberances beneath all that padding?  
The palace peons are here to help her prevail.

The Princess and The P's is a playful parlor word game in which all but one of the players (the Palace Peons) prompt the remaining player (the Princess) to guess a collection of secret objects whose names contain the letter P. If a Peon prevails, they’ll procure pearls as prizes. But they must take precautions not to use ANY words that contain the letter "P” (lest they procure penalties)... Players help the Princess prevail, and compete for the title of MVP (most valuable peon) in this semi-cooperative game.

Game Crafter Word-Up Challenge contest entry

Name: Pigeon Pie
Description:
The queen has grown tired of the same old pies. Potatoes, onions, pigeons, blackbirds…all of these ingredients have been declared ho-hum by her majesty. In an attempt to inspire her kitchen staff to be more innovative with their cooking, her Royal Highness has invited culinary experts from lands near and far to gather for an international feast in the Great Hall. She has chosen members of the court with the most discerning palates to taste these exotic pies, take notes, and give her their assessment of the flavors inside each dish. The taster with the most robust pallet will be promoted to head of the kitchen staff—a very prestigious position indeed.

In Pigeon Pie, players assume the roles of the queen’s royal pie-tasters. Each round, they will be served a pie with 6 slices (letters). They must try to detect all the subtle flavors contained in the pie by writing down as many “ingredients” (words) as possible using only the letters in the pie. They’ll gain points for original words, higher letter counts, and for identifying words with a culinary theme.

Game Crafter Word-Up Challenge contest entry

Name: Speed-E-Scoops!
Description:
Welcome to Speed-E-Scoops—the mom ‘n’ pop ice cream shop with international flair!

It's the height of summer, and the Speed-E-Scoops is a busy place, with many customers waiting in line to sample your scoops. You and your coworkers compete to see who can churn out the tallest cones and satisfy customers with the right flavor combos. When the shift is over, who will go home with the most tips?

In this ice-cream stacking word game, players draft ice cream scoops (letters) and compete to stack them into cones (words) while managing their workspace, a line of customers, and special requests. Earn points based on the length of each word, plus bonus points for taking care of customer needs. To win, end the game with the most points.

Game Crafter Word-Up Challenge 2022 contest entry

Name: Asteroid Empire
Description:
As the CEO of a new asteroid mining space start-up, your job is to make the most money from exploring nearby asteroids for precious resources. Coordinate your ships and their crew to claim and extract everything they can from these asteroids and return them to Earth for the biggest profit. The more you control the supply of one type of resource the more money you can make. But watch out for other competitors who want to expand their asteroid mining empires too!

Asteroid Empire is a 9 card game that puts rival CEO's of asteroid mining start-ups against each other to make the most profit. Can you make the most money and expand your space mining empire?
The aim is to be the mining start-up with the most money once all of the nearby asteroids have been mined and the game ends.

The game is played over a number of rounds in which players can explore or mine each asteroid. The player with the start token goes first, once they have placed a ship their opponent gets to place a ship and play continues to alternate until both players have placed all their ships (to either explore or extract) and the round ends. Once a ship has been placed in a round it cannot be moved or returned to the players hand. At the end of each round both players will retrieve all their ships and the start token is passed to the other player who will then go first in the next round. The remaining asteroids are not shuffled and left in the same order.

Once the last asteroid is claimed to be mined then the game ends and the materials extracted can be counted to determine who generated the most income. The income each resource is worth depends on how many cards of that resource each player has and is listed on each asteroid card with that resource type.

Name: Tentacolor
Description:
Deep in the ocean lives a strange and mysterious  creature. The only thing we know about it is its amazingly colorful tentacles! Scientists have made several  expeditions, but they’ve never managed to photograph this creature, which they’ve named Tentacolor. They’re relying on you, intrepid explorer!

Dive to the  ocean’s depths, find Tentacolor, and take photos of  its beautiful tentacles. You’ll need to be smarter than  the other explorers, since only one of you can photograph Tentacolor in its entirety!

Tentacolor is a drafting game for our younger players. On each turn, chose one of your cards, make the color match with the tentacle you are building and try to block your opponents.

The first player that matches 5 Tentacle cards wins.

Name: Mini Blitz Medieval
Description:
Blitz Built Games is the card game that brings a core rule system to your favorite characters.  Use one of the four Mini Blitz decks to equip four of your Legoâ€‹™ Minifigs with Medieval, Firearms, Lasers, or Magical Equipment. â€‹We provide a unique system made to open up into any and all of your favorite genres and you provide the rest.  Bring your own characters, victory conditions, and game style.

Medieval brings sharp weapons and pointy objects to your army.

Gameplay:
This Mini Blitz Deck can equip four units with a total of 8 BV (Battle Value). Assign a Form/Class card to a Minifig, which defines the basic rules for a single unit, then assign Equipment cards; each assigned card provides special rules but reduces the unit's Top Speed.

The scenario sets, or players agree, a Round BV. During your round, pay a unit's BV to activate it. When your Round BV is exhausted, play passes to the next player. During a unit's turn, it can Play an equipped card, Attack, or Move. Attacks are resolved by rolling 1d6 and checking the Attack Table on the equipment card, plus any special rules. Range and movement is measured in studs.

Name: Happy City: Golden Gate of Kyiv Promo Card
Description:
Promo card in French for Happy City by Cocktail Game. English language version by GameWright Games.

The card is a special red building.
To build it you will need:
2 yellow building.
2 blue building.

When the card is built, you get one heart for each blue card adjacent to a yellow card (left, right, top or bottom).

Information from publisher GameWright Games:
Last year, our Ukrainian publishing partner chose to localize Happy City in their country. However, they had one significant request: replace the "bonus building" card that features Moscow's Red Square with a Ukraine-centric landmark. Honoring their wishes, our partner reached out to the game's artist who illustrated a vibrant scene that incorporates the iconic Golden Gate of Kyiv along with a monument of Yaroslav the Wise (one of the most famous princes of Kyiv). But just as production was about to start, the conflict escalated, leading up to the tragic situation we now know. As a result, Happy City cannot be released in Ukraine.
Inspired by the actions of our dear partners at Cocktail Games and believing that every little bit helps, we decided to translate this symbolic card into English and offer it as a special release in solidarity with the citizens of Ukraine. For a $5 donation, you can get the card and we will contribute all of the proceeds to Global Giving's Ukraine Crisis Relief Fund.

Name: Bravo!
Description:
Ladies and Gentlemen! The most important circuses in the world are looking for Aerial artists, Acrobats, Equilibrists, Illusionists, Jugglers and Clowns. To ensure success, in addition to bringing memorable attractions, each circus also must offer spectators unique delicacies such as cotton candy, candy apples and popcorn. The circus that best satisfies its audience will be chosen as the greatest show on Earth!

A game of Bravo lasts 17 rounds. In each round, the Master of Ceremonies chooses one of three types of tiles to be acquired by the players: Inner Ring, Outer Ring or Audience. Once the choice is made, a number of tiles equal to the number of players plus one is revealed. A single bid auction is then held to decide who will be the new Master of Ceremonies, who will have the right to be the first to choose one of the open tiles. In a clockwise direction, the other players choose tiles, being able to spend tickets to open new options on the table. When all circuses are completed, players reveal their Ringmaster tile and all artists in each circus are scored. The value of each artist category is added and then multiplied by the number of that category icons in that circus Audience tiles. The player with the most points is the winner.

—description from the designer

Name: Soldier of the Queen
Description: Soldier of the Queen was designed as a fast moving set of rules for Colonial-era battles.  Separate tables were created to differentiate between specific combatants in different geographical regions.  Tables are included for the Anglo-Zulu War, Sudan, India, the Boxer Rebellion and the Boer wars.  SotQ includes rules for movement, infantry and artillery firing, melee, morale and fanaticism.

Name: Back To The Future: Time Travelling Board Game
Description:
Travel through the saga timeline. Roll the dice to decide your travels to the past or back to the future!

Similar game play to Snakes & Ladders. Roll the dice and follow the actions required by any cards or events on the board spaces. The first one to the end of the path wins.

Name: Dead Reckoning: Sea Dogs Expansion
Description:
These additional crew cards are used to provide asymmetric abilities to each player's deck as a fun alternate way to play or as a part of the Campaign Mode rules used with Saga Expansion 1 Deep Legends. (Saga Expansion 1 not required)

—description from the publisher

Name: Howl
Description:
Howl is a co-op, open world, tile laying, adventure game for 1-5 players, where you play as wolves and your goal as a team to complete a number tasks along with your pack before the summer days end. Chase, Hunt, Scavenge, and fight for survival in ever changing environment. You may also rescue wolf cubs and make unusual alliances with other species that will help you to access other regions of the map.

In your turn you may select a Wolf and Explore or Howl. To Explore, you pick a tile from the available offer and place adjacent to a tile on the table, matching vegetation. Then, move a wolf to one of the actions available in the newly placed tile (Observe, Get, Hunt, Chase, Give, etc). In order to complete an action, a wolf will roll a number of dice and, if successful, pick the numbered card and add it to the pack inventory. If you, manage to complete a task, or need to heal your wolves or regroup, then you should Howl.

A game ends in defeat if:

     One of the players has no remaining wolf or cub, and no other player is able to give them a cub.
     You run out of tiles without completing at least 4 tasks.


In this case wolves will learn, regroup, rebuild their strength and numbers and try again in the next time.

Howl has a myriad of paths to victory, multiple endings, puzzles, side quests and events triggered by player choices. The more you adventure, the more the game will reward you for remembering past choices.

Name: Ich will dein Führer sein
Description:
Each player gets 17 figures: 12 soldiers, 3 officers, 1 general and 1 leader.

At the start of the game the leader is placed on the half globe and the general on space e or f. The 3 officers are placed on the 3 spaces beside the general. The soldiers go on the 12 spaces in front of the officers and general.

The goal of the game 1 to take the opponents leader or to occupy the opponents home space (half globe) or the two general-spaces (e and f).

The leader and the general move 1 space in any direction. The officers move 1 space diagonal in any direction while the soldiers may move only 1 space diagonal forward. Soldiers or officers that get on an opponent general- or officer-space may get promoted.

All figures may take opponent figures only on diagonal adjacent spaces and may take more than 1 opponent if they are standing in a straight line behind the 1st figure.

In a second version of the game a die is used to determinate the number of spaces a figure may move. In this game movement is only diagonal.

Name: Wordl3s
Description:
Wordl3s is a word deduction game for two players. Guess the secret three-letter word of your opponent within 12 attempts using a combined process of deduction and elimination.
 On each turn, a player will:
1. Optionally flip a new word card
2. Pick a word to use for a question
3. Write it down on their form 
4. Ask the opponent a question
5. Record the answer.

The game ends when both players have guessed each others’ words. A player cannot exceed 12 attempts at filling out their form, in which case gets no score.

Name: Rackare! 2
Description: This box expands Rackare with 600 new cards, 200 white and 400 black. The expansion can be played alone without the main game. The mechanic is just the same as Cards Against Humanity where you fill in blanks with words or sentences from the cards you have at hand.

Name: Amerique 1500
Description:
We are in 1500, at a time when Europeans had not yet settled in America. A great fair is in preparation among all peoples.

In Amerique 1500, players compete to be the first to complete 3 tasks. On their turn, the player begins by rolling the nature die which will give an advantage to all players or only to the active player. Then, he will have to choose an action among these four: explore his territory (draw cards), barter (exchange resources), manufacture items (engine building) or play cards (to collect resources).

Versions
There are two ways to play Amerique 1500: the QUICK game and the FULL game. For a first game, it is recommended to play the fast version if children 10 and under play it.

Name: Rackare! 3
Description: Expands the base game with another 600 600 new cards that deal with everything from pandemics to electric scooters. 400 white cards and 200 black cards. Though this expansion can be played as it is without the base game.

Name: Rackarunge
Description:
Rackarunge is a simple game, to the point where the rules are impossible to misunderstand: Each round a player puts down a yellow card and the other players fill in their best pink cards. The one who put down the yellow card decide which the funniest combination. First to ten points wins the game and earns the title of being a real "Rackarunge".

This is a Swedish adaptation (cultural references as well as language) of Cards Against Humanity. Specifically, this is aimed to be suitable for a younger audience.

Name: Creature Comforts: Talents Micro-Expansion
Description: The Talents Micro-Expansion adds ten unique player powers to Creature Comforts via five double-sided cards. The cards are the same size as the Traveler cards in the base game. Each card is self-explanatory, so once you draft your Talent card, you know all the rules you need to play with your new talent.

Name: Creature Comforts: Dreams Come True Micro-Expansion
Description: The Dreams Come True Micro-Expansion provides a deck of twenty-five Dream cards. Each Dream card is a secret goal for you to achieve. You start the game with two Dream cards, but as you fulfill them, you take more. Each Dream card you fulfill provides a few extra points, but they can really add up!

Name: Toons and Towers
Description:
Toons And Towers is a card game that is loosely connected to a web comic series. The game involves two players who compete to try to drop their opponent's points to 0 before the end of the agreed time limit. Both players start a game with 80,000 points. Each player will have a deck of 50 cards consisting of cartoon, upgrade, and counter cards.

Both players start the game by drawing five cards from the top of their deck of cards. Each turn is broken into seven steps where players attack and defend aginst each other.

The game ends when one of two things are achieved; a player has been eliminated or the agreed time limit has been reached.

A player wins by successfully attacking his opponent's side of the field until they have reduced their opponent's points down to zero. This can also be achieved by having more remaining points than your opponent by the end of the agreed time limit.

Name: Onbashira:  Log Rider Festival
Description:
The Onbashira Festival has been held every six years for 1,200 years when the shrine's buildings of Suwa Taisha are rebuilt at Suwa City, Nagano Prefecture, in the Chubu region of Japan. The climax of the festival consists of the Kiotoshi (people riding the gigantic logs as they slide down a steep slope to prove their bravery) In this game you'll build up a crew of Kiotoshi and train them to make sure you have the best odds on surviving the steep slope to prove your bravery as they ride the logs down. Discover ancient survival technics and craft necessary gear that will help you to succeed as the bravest log riding crew for the next six years.

The game is played in multiple phases.

Worker placement phase: On your turn, you'll take 3 actions found around the city, move on around the board to gather resources including recruiting brave new Kiotoshi.

During the Action phase, you'll construct and place your Kiotoshion the logs and push them down the hill to score points.

Scoring phase: Each player will score the necessary points they earned around the board for easy tracking.

The game ends after 5 rounds or the fist player to construct a new tree to symbolize the reunification of nature and the elements. The person who has scored the most points wins.

Name: Canopy: the Table Top Balancing Game
Description:
Canopy is a simple balancing game, played with cards.

Players take it in turns to draw a card from the central pile and build out a canopy on top of a stand. The entertainment and jeopardy comes as the canopy grows and gets more unstable.

As the game progresses, the canopy gets wider and wider and more and more unstable until one unlucky player brings the whole thing crashing down.

Name: Wódz plemienia
Description:
Wódz plemienia ("The Tribe Chief") is a very interesting adventure game that will attract everyone. You have to prove that you are the best candidate for Chief of the Tribe.

A true leader must be resourceful, well-planned, charismatic, and committed to trading. Candidates take a test to select who best meets the above criteria. In addition to entrepreneurship and strategic skills, the character and talents assigned to your character are also important. In addition, your village is struggling with the adversities of nature, and fate brings surprises and opportunities that are worth taking advantage of.

THE COURSE OF THE GAME

The game takes place over the course of the year, and the passage of time is the movement of the pawn along the path of time. During each month, all players go through 4 Phases:

PHASE I - GROWTH
In this phase, all players successively: multiply their inventory, take 1 inhabitant, and take the crop from their crops.

PHASE II - TRADE
During this phase, all players buy or sell their 4 inventory tokens. Additionally, whoever has a purchase can go to it and sell tokens there, regardless of the general trade.

PHASE III - CONSTRUCTION
In this phase, players can perform one of the three actions: set up a crop, build a store, or train a buying staff.

PHASE IV - FATE
In this phase, the players roll the dice. Whoever gets an odd number of spots skips fate. Whoever has an even number of spots - he draws the "Fate" card for himself and is used to write it. If having a specific character trait gives you extra prots, it is written on the card and then we follow this notation.

The description of the actions in each phase is additionally written on the board.

After the end of the 4 Phases, we move the time pawn to the next month and start the queue again.

MAGICAL NIGHT
When the movement pawn reaches the MAGIC NIGHT space, we read aloud what happens to the entire village. The record on the card applies to all players. If the holder of a character trait is treated specially, it is recorded on the card.
After following the instructions on the Magic Night card, move the pawn to the next month.

EXCHANGE
If, as a result of writing on the card, one player has to pay something to the other, but he does not have the appropriate amount, he returns the inventory tokens to the bank, exchanges them for $ and pays the opponent. If one player has to give the other an inventory token, but he doesn't have one, he pays the equivalent of $ ($ 1 for 1 inventory). If, as a result of writing on the card, one player has to give the other a citizen token, but he does not have one, then he pays the equivalent of $ ($ 1 per 1 inhabitant).

CORONATION

After the time pawn reaches this space, the points are scored
individual players.

Name: Rad Zone Totality
Description:
The world faces a terrible apocalypse. Without warning the sun’s radiation spiked to alarming levels and under this relentless and deadly barrage humanity succumbed. People fell ill, millions died, populations moved underground into fortified Rad Bunkers, all the time the sun pushing people deeper into the darkness. Many plants and animals perished, and society collapsed. Food and clean water were rationed until people began to starve, and martial law was replaced by irradiated outlaws and bandits roaming the surface in their pain induced craze.

It is down to you to guide a group of survivors as they scavenge for resources on the harsh irradiated surface so they may return and survive in their underground bunker. Can you avoid the radiation hot spots and find the right supplies? Can you escape a terrible fate at the hands of the crazed Rad Heads…can you survive the Rad Zone?

Rad Zone Totality is the follow up game to Rad Zone and although it incorporates the original rules it includes many new ones and players do not need the original game to play it.

—description from the publisher

Name: Zenda: le maitre du stress
Description:
Objective: Understand and manage stress

Answer questions and complete "Zen challenges" to advance Zenda to the temple. But be careful, you have to get to the end of the course before the ninja, who represents the stress!

Zenda: The Stress Master is designed to help children aged 7 to 14 develop their understanding of stress and their ability to manage it in different everyday situations. The game also leads them to realize that stress is a healthy and useful reaction that is different for each person.

—description from the publisher (translated)

Objectif : Comprendre et gérer le stress

Réponds aux questions et réalise des « défis zen » pour faire avancer Zenda jusqu’au temple. Mais attention, tu dois arriver au bout du parcours avant le ninja, qui représente le stress!

Zenda : le maitre du stress est conçu pour aider les enfants de 7 à 14 ans à développer leur compréhension du stress et leur habileté à le gérer dans différentes situations du quotidien. Le jeu les amène aussi à prendre conscience que le stress est une réaction saine et utile qui est différente pour chaque personne.

—description from the publisher

Name: Death Note: Le Jeu d'Enquête
Description:
Death Note is a hidden identity game in the anime universe, each character having their own objectives to achieve.

At the beginning of the game, the only role revealed, having the role of GM will be L. His mission will be to lead the investigation, distributing suspicions during the 5 rounds of the game with the ultimate goal of discovering who plays the role of Light.

The other players have all their own goals, could help L or not... On each round, they have as main action to look at the active hidden investigation and decide to keep it active or not. If yes, he can add an action card to his hand. These actions cards could be played at different moment during the game, regarding what is indicated on the card.
When each layer around L have looked at the investigation card, L reveals the active one, apply the effect and give the suspicions indicated. At 6 suspicions, a role is revealed.

After 5 rounds, if L is not revealed, he lose the game. 
The other player reveal their role, winning some victory points regarding their achieved goals.

The game can be ended earlier if Light is revealed or if 3 role are revealed and killed.

Name: Pendulum Fighters
Description:
This a TCG to takes a twist on the usual TCG formula and brings something new to the table and hopefully TCG enthusiast will enjoy. Pendulum Fighters is a dice rolling anime TCG where the goal is to get your opponent's character cards health down to 0,

this can be done by normal battling, or turn up the heat with amplifier cards to assist you in battle and help you catch your opponent off guard or if you are in a pinch, use finisher to jump right back into the game. Just note that using these cards may have a drawback when used that can affect you.

The goal of Pendulum Fighters is to give you the feeling of  a heated battle of who is really stronger...As well as some lore into the world and a full story told within the cards themselves.

If you feel that this game has peaked your interest then check down in the "Links" to find out how you can get your hands on this game.

—description from the designer

Name: Eispicker
Description:
This fun game of skill can be played in two different versions with 2-4 players. Carefully remove the ice blocks from the ice wall with the ice pick or show off your skills on the ice tower. Your skill is tested in both of these exciting versions, because if the penguin falls, the game is over!

1.Version: Ice wall The game starts when the ice wall is set up and the penguin is in position. You can play this game with 2-4 people. The players take turns to carefully pick an ice block out of the wall with the small hammer (ice pick). Players always have to keep an eye on the little penguin, because if it falls off the wall, the game is over! The player who makes the penguin fall off loses the game.

2.Version: Ice tower Players now take turns to pull out a block of ice from the tower with their hands. The same applies here: If the penguin falls, the game is over and the player who caused it loses the game!

Name: Pensum
Description:
A trivia game where all players are asked questions from a card, one question (A-E) at a time.
If at any time a player chooses not to answer, or answers wrongly, they do not get to answer the rest of the questions. When all questions have been asked, or when all players are out, players move on the board depending on how many correct answers they have.
At certain points on the track, the players need at least a certain number of correct answers, thereby giving the other players a chance to catch up.

—user summary

Name: Dare or Dare
Description:
The fast paced, dare based adult party game. See how far you’re willing to go to come out on top. You will be embarrassed, laughing at others, and if all goes right (or wrong), feeling very good.

Roll the tri die, and draw a card from the deck with the corresponding color. The choice is now yours: either perform the dare on the top half of the card, complete it, and collect the points; or decline, lose a life, and put the card face down.

Keep the contents of the bottom half to yourself, because any other player may pick it up and attempt it. Provided they succeed where you failed, they get to collect the points.

Ultimately collect twelve points and crown yourself as the dare champion!

—description from the designer

Name: Deck EXPRESS: Southern Railway
Description:
The Southern Railway Company (SOU) once operated a primary repair shop for locomotives in Spencer, North Carolina. This is a railroad investment game where players purchase shares in emerging railroad companies, build track, and profit from dividends at a train yard. Cards in hand represent a player’s money. Acquire the most money before the bank runs out to win the game.

Deck Express is an exciting series of railroad investment games where players purchase stocks, build track, and profit from locomotives. Each rail line features a unique train game, custom artwork, and rulebook using a standard deck of playing cards for the game components. All aboard!

Name: BLASTER: Games Anthology 04
Description:
BLASTER: Vol. 4 includes two exclusive standalone games, and three expansions.

Last Days: Legends
Official Expansion for Last Days
Rules for including The Luchador, The Mechanic, and the Waitress in your games of Last Days. These rules are compatible with the modern game setting and both the core Rulebook and Seasons Supplements. Keep an eye out for new miniatures available via Temple of the West.

BRUTL! Tank Arena
Standalone Game
BRUTL! Tank Arena is a beer and pretzels style game of insanely fun tank battles. Your humble author wanted a ruleset to use all those cool tanks he had lying around, but something simple and required minimal effort.  With only a bit of terrain and a single tank per player, BRUTL! Is both easy to start and plays quick, getting to the best parts of miniature wargaming, blowing up your opponent.

Sludge Nations
Expansion for Sludge War, core rules available in BLASTER: Games Anthology 03.
The world of sludge is vast and each player’s interpretation of the setting is a valid iteration in the decaying multiverse. The Nation Factions described here will represent both existing nations and archetypes found across the dying world. For what it’s worth, these factions are primarily focused on the western branchways inhabited by mankind and don’t represent the full breadth of the sludge world.

Gaslands: Legacy (Part II)
Official Campaign Expansion for Gaslands: Refuelled, part I available in BLASTER: Games Anthology 03.
Earth gets an eviction notice from Mars, and becomes dismantled and reassembled into a progressively more chaotic post-post-apocalyptic world. Randomly generate an illegal build and get out of the factory fast before you become dismantled yourself. Unique LEGACY Gaslands rules, and the remaining narrative scenarios. (The first five scenarios in the story are b in Vol. 3, but you don't need them to play these four, as the Legacy Rules are recapped in Vol.4.)

Deathship One
Solo/Co-op Standalone Game
Deathship One is a solo or co-operative miniatures game in which the player controls a small squad of warriors attempting to fight their way through an alien death trap. It’s designed to be fast and fun and to use a minimum of miniatures and terrain. It’s also designed to be limited. The whole game consists of 5 scenarios or ‘rooms’. The order of those rooms can change from game-to-game, but you always play all five, assuming you live that long

—description from the publisher

Name: Token Economy
Description:
Token Economy is set in the world of modern finance, where you can buy tokens as a share of an object, which can or cannot be divided in real (soccer stadiums, clubs, oldtimers...). The currency you pay with and you can bet on, are crypto currencies, like the well known BitCoin.

Players move around the track in a Monopoly-style, having junctions in some places. The space where you move to, determines which share you may buy, or how much rent you have to pay. Some spaces cause events, or changes in stock prices. At the end, the player with the most valuable assets is the winner.

Name: Smash Up: Deepreef Crag Promo Card
Description:
To promote their Kickstarter campaign for Dead Reckoning, AEG released free print-and-play promotional cards for several of their games, such as Tiny Towns, Santa Monica, Space Base, Cat Lady, and of course Smash Up. Physical copies of the promos are available to those who pledged it.

Deepreef Crag is the promo card for Smash Up. It is a base that reads: When this base scores, it the total power equals the breakpoint, the winner gains 1 additional VP.

Name: Cat Lady: Calico Jack Promo Card
Description:
Kickstarter exclusive Promo Card available for add-on purchase from the Dead Reckoning Campaign.

New Stray Cat:

Calicio Jack - Stray Cat
5VP if you have the pirate costume. When adopted, steal a tuna from your neighbors

Originally intended as a print and play according to AEG (the manufacturer):  “By popular demand, a way to get the printed versions of the print-and-play pirate-themed promo cards we made for other AEG games to celebrate Dead Reckoning.“

Print and Play available here:

https://www.alderac.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/CatLady_CalicoJack_1.pdf

Name: Space Base: Dead Reckoning Promo Cards
Description:
A 6-card promo pack originally available through the Dead Reckoning Kickstarter campaign. These cards are treasure excavators - ships that allow you to keep the credits you do not spend.

Cards are:

Queen Annie's Revenge - This turn keep all coin you do not spend  
Whodah - This turn keep all coin you do not spend
The Red Shih - This turn keep all coin you do not spend
Kraken's Maw - This turn keep all coin you do not spend
Setting Sun - This turn keep all coin you do not spend
Royal Misfortune - This turn keep all coin you do not spend

Alt text on cards is: This turn keep all coin you do not spend.

Name: There's a Song for That
Description:
There’s A Song For That is an adult party game inspired by Cards Against Humanity and What Do You Meme. Music fans will love this game.  There’s A Song For That is for 3 or more players and is intended for adults. Gameplay lasts between 30-90 minutes.  There are over 200 cards in a deck.

How To Play

     Each player picks six random song title cards.
      Players take turns picking a situation card.
      Each of the remaining players play a song title card that they think best goes with the situation card.
     The player who played the situation card picks the song title card they think goes best. that player gets a point. 
     The Player at the end of the game with the most points wins.


—description from the designer

Name: Hostile Environment: Special Forces
Description:
Hostile Environment: Special Forces is a fast-paced tactical 28mm miniatures game that is designed to be played on a battle mat with a 1” grid. The game is based on the Hostile Environment world, but players may use whatever modern or futuristic miniatures they have from Vietnam, Cold War or Science Fiction eras.

Hostile Environment uses a die-pull initiative system to keep players on their toes. Better soldiers get greater odds of more activations, but lesser soldiers are allowed more numbers to keep fights balanced.

Each miniature represents a single unit ranging in skill from green to elite. There are over 15 different weapon types and 6+ armor types from modern weapons and armor to alt-future tech.

Most matches take about 90 minutes using at most two dozen miniatures.

H.E.: Special Forces can be played solo, using the Hostile Tactical AI card deck (sold separately).

2050, the world has entered total chaos. P68P, a poisonous pollen has killed over a billion people, while the toxic gnidia plant, once bred in labs, continues to spread like wildfire. Governments that once ruled humanity have fallen into darkness.

“The Great Wipe,” a hacker attack by the Red 76’ers in 2038 has virtually erased the internet. Now, only a few left have the knowledge to bring back the sciences that have been forgotten. Only the READ, a source of collective consciousness, allows mankind to share information. But, Paven the creator of “the language of God,” rules from the grave, spreading his mesmerism into weaker minds, leaving the zombies to his controlling thoughts.

Failure of silver, the nano blood that cured cancer and heart disease has left mankind grappling with age old viruses thought to be extinct. Scarmine Lab’s mercenaries formed a special force of Population Insurance Tactics (PIT) to find humans that can still create antibodies that have become dormant in most humans.

All that is left of the world is a Hostile Environment.

—description from the publisher

Name: Turf War: Unicorn City
Description: In Turf War: Unicorn City, you role play as the prospective leader of a gang of adorably cute unicorns (if I don't say so myself), must recruit them from the deck into your squad, and then engage in "rumbles" against other players to decide who ultimately wins the turf war.

Name: TwinStar Valley
Description:
TwinStar Valley is a fun and accessible competitive game that has you controlling a mining company active in a beautiful secluded valley. You will construct a logistical network to transport valuable gemstones towards self-build workshops. 
The goal of the game is to both earn a capital through carefully selling these assets to a fluctuating market and fulfilling contracts that allow you to score Victory points.

The game combines route-building and market manipulation but attempts to present these elements in an easy to grasp system, offering freedom and tough decisions.
Twinstar uses a unique Action selection mechanism and original twists to the genre of logistical games to create a fun, intense and joyful experience that both casual an more experienced gamers can enjoy.

—description from the designer

Name: El Albañil de Horus
Description:
Elkin is a stonemason Horus spoke to in a dream giving him the secret to end the tyranny of his oppressors under his people.

The objective of the game is to get 3 magic bricks to line up in order to collapse the pyramid!

In each turn, the player will have to move forward (orthogonally or diagonally) one of their bricks, capture one opponent's brick (jumping above it, taking it to their opponent's first row), jump over one of their own bricks, or make a wall movement (move or jump laterally) on the fifth row. Movements can be combined in one turn with the same brick.

The game ends when a player wins by getting three bricks on the fifth row, or breaking five opponent's bricks (when they reach the sixth row).

—user summary

Name: Paper Dungeons: Missões Extras
Description:
Paper Dungeons: Missões Extras is a kit of 4 promotional dungeons that adds to the replayability of the original game and expand the game's narrative.
A mandatory extra for those who want the complete Paper Dungeons experience.

Name: Mord im Villenviertel: Wer tötete Edith Krause?
Description:
The tranquil little town of Waldstedt am See is in shock. A murder has taken place! While solving the case a family drama unravels that puzzles the investigators. Hence, the public prosecutor decides to hand the case over to you, students of the police academy, to help solve the mysterious murder case. You will have to investigate as a team, examine evidence and analyse interrogations. Who is responsible for the murder? Who is innocent? Find the clues and solve the case!

As a team (or solo if that’s your thing) you will have to investigate all police documents, determine the murder weapon, unseal sealed documents, interrogate persons of interest, corroborate their alibis and find the culprit who killen the old and wealthy leady Mrs. Edith Krause.  Your investigations will take place in a multimedia environment - just as real investigative work! You will receive a police file and sealed record as hard copies and will need to use your laptop or mobile phone to log into the digital records of the crime case. Here you will be able to talk to persons of interest, the public prosecutor of Waldstedt am See and answer questions to your ongoing investigation.

The murder mystery investigation will take you approximately 90 to 180 minutes. Due to the sealed document, which you first need to unseal, you can easily split your crime investigation into two evenings and continue the next day - no problem!

The murder mystery case investigation is suitable for children from the age of 12 years and above. We recommend the help of adults and to not leave children to their own devices, they will/might need assistance. The investigation is primarily aimed at adults.


Im beschaulichen Städtchen Waldstedt am See wird es spannend. Ein Mord ist geschehen! Bei der Aufklärung des Falls entspinnt sich ein Familiendrama, welches die Ermittler:innen vor ein Rätsel stellt. Aus diesem Grund beschließt die Staatsanwaltschaft, Euch, die Studierenden der Polizeiakademie, als neue Ermittler zu Rate zu ziehen. Ermittelt gemeinsam, untersucht die Asservate und analysiert die Verhöre. Wer hat den Mord begangen? Und wer ist unschuldig? Findet die Beweise und klärt den Fall!

—description from the publisher

Name: Don't Get Got!: Con Edition
Description:
Extra pack of stand alone challenges given away at various conventions including Airecon 2022.

This game is all about completing secret missions, so when you open the pack, make sure that you read the rules and don't look at all the cards. Otherwise, you won't be able to play - which would be very sad indeed.

Name: Roll-Z: Coop Mode
Description:
This is the cooperative mode expansion for Roll-Z and requires the base game to play.

This two-player mode is played pretty much the same way as the base game, but we recommend that you familiarize yourself with the base game before moving on to this mode.

Name: World of Tanks Miniatures Game: German – Jagdpanzer (38t) Hertzer Expansion
Description:
More commonly known as the Hetzer, this pocket sized tank destroyer provides a low cost option for the points conscious commander. If you have points to spare though then there are plenty of options to customise it’s performance on the battlefield.

The Jagdpanzer 38(T) Hetzer is a crowd favourite. It combines a solid set of stats, a deceptively small size and a relatively low cost that makes it an affordable Tank Destroyer for a platoon commander on a budget. Left alone at the back of the battlefield sniping enemies it will quickly earn it’s keep, but with a few small upgrades you can really enhance the ability of the Hetzer to be a threat on the table as well as improving it’s chances of surviving. First up an Improved Rotation Mechanism will give your tank a nice improvement to its initiative, increasing your chances of being in the right place to get your shots off. Adding Wilhelm Lindemann to your crew will also improve your initiative in the movement phase whilst also increasing your chances of avoiding critical hits. Last but not least, a crew member with the Concealment ability will stack with the inherent Tank Destroyer special rule and keep your tank safe whilst in cover.

Name: World of Tanks Miniatures Game: American – M24 Chaffee Expansion
Description:
The M24 Chaffee is a real speedster, combing high initiative and movement to find the perfect spot on the battlefield. Combine this with the new Commanders Vision System and you can aid your allies by stripping away an enemies Cover for the rest of the phase.

The American built M24 Chaffee brings a new Light Tank to the battlefield and unlike the older Valentine this one is fast… we mean really fast! Combining high speed and good initiative with a gun that cannot be easily ignored, it is a threat to every other tank on the battlefield. Befitting it’s role as a spotter, an easy addition is a Commanders Vision System. This allows the Chaffee to strip away enemy tanks cover bonus, making them an easier target for other friendly tanks.

The key there is to make sure you have the highest initiative possible on this tank and if you need a little buff to achieve that, then the 75mm Gun M17 is exactly what you need.

Name: World of Tanks Miniatures Game: Soviet – T-70 Expansion
Description:
With over 8,000 tanks built during the war, the T-70 was the mainstay of Soviet light tank units. Straight of the box it combines some fairly average stats, but with a little work the T-70 can shine in any situation with specific upgrades available for the gun and engine.

The T-70 adds another Light Tank to the mix. Built in large numbers by the Soviet army it is a blank canvas ready for commanders to tweak to meet their mission needs. It comes with relatively high initiative (for a Soviet vehicle) but this can be improved through use of the M-80 engine which enhances the tanks initiative in the movement phase – it also works on the SU-76 and SU-122A (spoilers!). As a Light Tank the T-70 doesn’t necessarily have the highest number of hit points or defense but a Low Noise System has the potential to give a light tank a nice defensive buff, if the dice are on your side.

Name: World of Tanks Miniatures Game: British – Crusader Expansion
Description:
Widely known for it’s performance in the deserts of North Africa the Crusader is perfect for high speed attack runs on an unsuspecting enemy. Combine its naturally high initiative with Improved Communications to give a boost to the entire platoon.

The Crusader, used by the British in the deserts of North Africa, is another speedster like the American M24 Chaffee. It gains an additional hit point over its American friend, but at the cost of two crew slots and the Arrow Shot special rule (which means it is less likely to cause critical hits). This means that straight of the box it will hang around longer, but possibly at the cost of dealing less damage… but if you are in the fight for one extra round that may be all the time you need to win the game! If you are looking to reduce the cost of your tank you can upgrade the gun to an OQF 3-inch Howitzer MK.I which removes the Arrow Shot rule and gives your tank High Explosive. This is a great option if you are feeling lucky with your dice… well are you?

Name: Stardust Coffee
Description:
Story:
the 17th century, Ottoman Turk Empire, one of the most powerful states at that time, marched west to Austria and because of that, Arabs began to bring coffee into Europe. From that moment on, coffee has become one of the most popular drinks in the world. Then hundreds of years have passed, and even though travel between universes has become a daily routine like taking buses, coffee has spread from Earth to different Space Cities, the colonial satellites in outer space. Enjoying a cup of high-quality coffee every day has become the most anticipated thing for residents of Space Cities every day.

After hundreds of years passed, a space expedition led by Dr. Brent Tully discovered an organic material called "Stardust". By adding only a small amount of this magic ingredient, the flavors and aroma of any coffee are greatly enhanced. Moreover, the more freshly picked Stardust, the more it can improve the quality of coffee. This triggered a coffee revolution! In pursuit of the ultimate flavors, many new expeditions have been established on different Space Cities with the goal of "seeking the freshest Stardust and ingredients for the first time and delivering the most delicious coffee". Beside the danger of sailing the spaceship across the galaxy, there is a robber called "Galaxy Pirates", which is more threatening to them...

Game Aim:
In Stardust Coffee, you control a space expedition and sail your spaceships across the Galaxy. You collect different ingredients for coffee making and score by delivering the coffee back to your Starbase. Collecting Stardust and adding them to your coffee is another way to boost your Victory Points (VPs). By upgrading your spaceships, you could also speed up your collection of ingredients or Stardust.
When the game goes on, the Galaxy Pirates will attack your Spaceships and rob your ingredients. By fighting back the Galaxy Pirates, you get Honor points and it will be another source of scoring. Only the player who could manage the Spaceships the best would gain most VPs to win the game.

—description from the designer

Name: Violent Dark
Description:
Violent Dark (formerly Anomaly) is a 32mm co-op or head-to-head game that pits the crew of a massive corporation’s ship or planetary facility against the threats of the galaxy that lurk and prey beyond The Dark. A game is played with 3-5 miniatures per side on a 2’×2′ area.

Violent Dark can be played as a solo game, a player will have control of four crew models to complete the selected mission against an A.I. driven threat; a multiplayer game allowing each player to activate and choose the destiny of a single or multiple crew models against an A.I. threat; or a One vs Many scenario for someone to play as the Threat itself! One person playing the chosen threat and four players controlling a crew model.

Violent Dark pits four crew against a threat that the players choose before the game begins.  The core game provides everything necessary to play the core five missions. Missions are played on a two foot by two foot play area and filled with terrain as well as selected or randomly chosen environmental conditions. Players will also randomly choose a Plan B. These represent sub objectives the players may try to accomplish for minor and moral victories.

—description from the publisher

Name: Prime Stone
Description:
"Rainbow ore is a legendary mineral that is more beautiful than any mineral. Many alchemists are trying to figure out how to make Rainbow ore from different minerals. Every day these alchemists have to find the necessary ore. But finding the required ore is not an easy task. They may have to rely on some luck sometimes. Sometimes it may be ore, But sometimes it might get a stone."

Prime Stone is an educational board game designed for classroom use. The game rules are simple enough to develop calculating skills, which are a necessary basis for learning mathematics at a higher level. The prime Stone game can be used to educate about integer factorization and review content such as the greatest common divisor and least common multiple, prime numbers, composite numbers, powers, and other related topics. Teachers can use it to schedule classroom activities and play outside of school hours. Parents can play with their children to help them improve their math skills.

Players can choose to do one of three things: Pick, Mix and Build. Details are as follows: 1) Take two tiles from the bag and place them in front of the player. If the player picks up one stone tile, the player places the picked tile in front and puts the stone tile back into the bag. 2) Combine two or three tiles placed in front of the player using Multiply and put the old and new tiles back into the bag. 3) Create Rainbow ore from the target card. Using two or three tiles placed in front of the player multiplies any number of the target cards. Players can use those two or three tiles to create rainbow ore by having the player put the tile used to create it back into the bag. Then put the target card in front of the player and put the number of stone tiles specified in the target card into another player's bag. (will give stone tiles all with one player or distributed to multiple other players) and then open a new target card to replace it.

There are two conditions to ending the game, either 1) the player generates eight rainbow ore or 2) the player collects four target cards. When one of the players meets the condition, play that round as the last round and count rainbow ore number. The player with the most number of rainbow ore is the winner.

Name: Stacks
Description:
Stacks is a fast-playing, abstract tactical game for two players.

The game is played on a 5 x 5 grid (25 spaces in total). Each player gets 10 playing pieces either in red or black. Your pieces start on stacks of 2 on your own home spaces, adjacent to the main playing grid.

In each turn, a player can move one or more of their pieces across the board. The aim of the game is to get four or more of your pieces into the opponent’s home spaces, or to eliminate six or more of the opponent’s pieces.

The game is easy to learn, and is highly re-playable, offering players interesting and difficult tactical and strategic choices.

Name: The Valley
Description:
Deep in the hidden wilds of the New Zealand bush, an engineered wilderness is flourishing. After years of intensive, secret research, edible species from Aotearoa and all over the world finally flourish year-round in the Valley, a forager's paradise in a climate-controlled biodome.

You are a Cottager, leading your team of Gatherers to forage for harvest goods, learn your craft from local Artisans, and craft the best recipes to sell to your customers. Move around the modular hex tile Valley, choosing from actions to harvest, make recipes, visit Artisans, complete Goals, and get those sales. Choose recipes from a river of cards that include good and bad event cards - play the standard game or add the Spice cards for increased complexity - but take care, as every card drawn can precipitate Nightfall, the end of the day, where the board resets, the overnight growth cycle restocks the resource tiles, and all Gatherers return to the Cottage with their laden baskets.

The game ends when the Recipe cards run out and the final Night falls. After you have added your Goal points to your recipe card values, the player with the highest score is the winner.

The Valley is very flexible - with 2 to 6 players, and gameplay from 20 minutes to several hours, you can play a quick game by ending the game on the first or second Nightfall card, or play with up to 6 rounds, each ending in a Night. You can also control the complexity by adding in Spicy Recipes, Event cards, Goals, and by using your Cottager abilities.

The Valley is set in New Zealand, so it also features recipe ingredients and cultural terms which only apply in Aotearoa. While these are covered briefly in the Glossary, we encourage you to jump down that rabbithole and learn more about this beautiful country!

Name: Undertow: The Beach Game
Description:
It's a fine day at the beach and everyone is out swimming. But the Undertow is pulling you, your family, and friends out to sea! It’s a race to see who can get their family back to the beach safely before they are lost forever…

Undertow - The Beach Game is a quick and fun rainy day game where you roll dice and try to rescue your friends and family before the other players.

During setup players roll a number of dice (determined by how many players) and take turns placing them in the water (the game board) based on the number rolled.

Each turn consists of rolling three turn dice; two for movement and one modifier die. The movement dice determine how many outward and inward moves need to be made by the players swimmers. The modifier die changes these moves including bonuses like "The Big Wave" that allows more inward movement, and "Undertow!" where all movement needs to be outward.
 The game ends when any player has moved all their swimmers to the safety of The Beach.

—description from the designer

Name: Reavers of Midgard: Tafel der Wiedergeburt
Description:
Promocard from the Crowdfunding of Support Berlin Con at Spieleschmiede.

Table of Rebirth

Any: Discard this artifact to take one of your Reavers from your Glory Pile and use it as if you recruited it.

Tafel der Wiedergeburt

Beliebig: Wirf dieses Artefakt ab, um 1 Räuberkarte von deinem Ruhmstapel zu nehmen und sie zu verwenden als hättest du sie gerade erst erhalten.

Name: Gluty Bear and the Wurst Truck
Description:
Late evening in the Black Forest. The hungry lumberjacks gather for some grilled wurst. Can the gluten-
intolerant bear steal one? Or will it end up with a bread roll and a belly ache?

Gluty Bear and the Wurst Truck is a mini card game of just 7 cards. The objective is to either eat the wurst being the bear or to eat the wurst and bun as a lumberjack (fork).

Players have just one card on their hands which they repeatedly swap in secret with two cards lying in middle of the table. They try to track where the wurst and everything else is and wait in patience for the right moment to dive in with either bear or fork in order to eat.

—description from the designer

Name: Ciemna Strona Mydła
Description:
The game consists in arranging five-word sentences from word cards divided into 5 levels of "sharpness". The players randomly choose one of them and try to dominate the sentence with words with their level. To make it not too easy, word cards have effects that significantly affect the gameplay and allow you to plan your strategies.

Classic variant: 170 cards + instruction.

Deluxe variant: 170 cards + 50 cards from the Pierwsze Namydlenie expansion + instructions.

Every player on their turn add one card to form a sentence and selects a new card on hand. The cards are arranged in the following order: adjective, noun, verb, noun, adverb. On the first card, more are placed, changing the sentence. The meaning of the sentence does not matter, what counts is the markings (numbers) on the cards. The resulting sentences are fun, but just an extra dose. Some cards also have additional functions that make the game easier for their owner or make it difficult for opponents. When someone dominates the sentence with his sign, he wins and the game is over.

Name: The Carniverse: Dark Eden
Description:
Eden has gone dark, but your survival is just beginning. Dark Eden is the 1st major expansion for the Carniverse skirmish game. Within its pages you'll find additions to features that already exist in the game, as well as a host of completely new mechanics to keep you on your toes as you try to fend off the dinosaurs.

This 80+ page PDF is jammed packed with content to give your campaigns new life as you continue your survival in the new world!

—description from the publisher

Name: Heroes of Qalanor
Description:
Heroes of Qalanor is a solo/co-op tabletop dungeon crawling adventure game for 1 to 4 players. The game is miniature agnostic.

The land of Qalanor (Kal-an-or) on the planet Threa (Th-ray) is an Island and the largest land mass on the planet. It stretches five thousand miles from the snow capped Karg mountain range in the North to the jungles and deserts of the South and three and a half thousand miles from the rich farming lands in the West to the vibrant sun drenched lands in the East.

Many cultures call Qalanor their home and many races dwell in the cities, towns, villages and wilds. The predominant civilised races are Humans, Elves, Dwarfs and Halflings. Some even band together to form adventuring parties of wizards and warriors skilled with spell, bow and sword.

These adventurers seek fortune and fame, accepting quests to rid the land of monsters plaguing Hamlets and Villages or battling blood thirsty cultists beneath city streets! Wherever there is gold to be made and magic items to be found there will be a Hero of Qalanor ready to quest!

—publisher's description

Name: Hectic Harvest
Description:
HABA Contest Finalist 2020
        Ciutat de Granollers Semi-Finalist 2025
    


In Hectic Harvest, you are a gardener who is trying to plant a plentiful garden of veggies of five different types, while trying to avoid pesky rabbits that are attracted to your well-tended garden.

Hectic Harvest is a pattern building, tile placement game for all ages that has an intuitive and challenging solo mode, scalable multiplayer and a Super Seed that allows you to break the rules for one turn!

Plan your garden by selecting vegetables that help you create large areas to maximize points.  Intelligent planting is key because when rabbits invade your garden, they always have access to half of it.  While all players are targeted by the same rabbit, a well placed vegetable can be the difference between winning and losing.

Strategize how your garden is built as you take advantage of important bonuses that reward you for planting a variety of veggies or only 1 type in any row or column.

After selecting vegetables, you move all remaining tokens to the right.  This intriguing mechanic allows a vegetable token to change importance by turn.

—description from the designer

Name: 5 Paths: A Tactical Brawl
Description:
A quick and dirty roll move and capture. Each game takes 15-30 minutes on average and you win by being the first to capture 5 of your opponent's pieces or locking them out of the game.

Each player places a combination of 5 archetype pieces on the board (each archetype uses 2d6 in a specific way). Some pieces capture by landing on enemy pieces while others capture at a distance and some even stun and drag enemy pieces.

Every turn follows the same rhythm of a player declaring which piece they intend to use, rolling the dice if appropriate, and then applying that die value to the pieces they selected in order to dominate their opponents or mitigate their risk depending on how the dice came up.

—description from the publisher

Name: Wits & Wagers: Las Vegas, Baby! – Expansión: Terraplanistas
Description:
We don't believe in witches, but there are, there are.

Exlusive Print & Play expansion for the Argentinian edition of Wits & Wagers: It's Vegas, Baby!, that can be obtained by messaging the publisher on Instagram (as stated in the base game rulebook).

It includes a cover card and 7 new question cards, where there were gathered questions about popular beliefs, conspiracy theories, superstitions and paranormal events.

Name: Wits & Wagers: Las Vegas, Baby! – Expansión: ¿Vivimos en el Mismo Mundo?
Description:
Exlusive Print & Play expansion for the Argentinian edition of Wits & Wagers: It's Vegas, Baby!, that can be obtained by messaging the publisher on Instagram (as stated in the base game rulebook).

It includes a cover card and 7 new question cards, where there were gathered questions designed for you who enjoy being told incredible curiosities, watch a documentary on Discovery and are shocked for weeks and store piles of useless information in your head... And you often wonder how can it be that that and I live in the same planet?

Name: Wits & Wagers: Las Vegas, Baby! – Expansión: Millennials
Description:
Were you born between the 80s and 90s? Did you grow up to Britney's hits and playing Minesweeper on Windows XP?

Exlusive Print & Play expansion for the Argentinian edition of Wits & Wagers: It's Vegas, Baby!, that can be obtained by messaging the publisher on Instagram (as stated in the base game rulebook).

It includes a cover card and 7 new question cards, where there were gathered questions about pop culture, technology from another era, movies, music and much more. Disconnect dial up internet and let's play!

Name: Wits & Wagers: Las Vegas, Baby! – Expansión: Nocturna
Description:
Exlusive Print & Play expansion for the Argentinian edition of Wits & Wagers: It's Vegas, Baby!, that can be obtained by messaging the publisher on Instagram (as stated in the base game rulebook).

It includes a cover card and 7 new question cards, where there were gathered questions about zombies, ghosts, nightmarish creatures and serial killers that have struck fear into the hearts of fans for decades. This expansion is our gift to those who cannot read these sentences without getting chills:
"Here's Johnnyyy!"
"Whatever you do... Don't fall asleep!"
"I see dead people"
"We all go a little crazy, sometimes"

Name: It's a Wonderful Kingdom: Promo Pack
Description:
5 promo cards/Promo kaarten (5 kaarten)  with images and no text.

2x Steengroeve / Stone quarry

1x Huurlingen / Mercenaries

1x Paleis  / Palace

1x Doolhof van Fenhror  / Maze of Fenhror

Name: Mid-Life Crisis: Helpline!
Description:
Players are divided into counselors and a caller, and the caller changes every round.

As a counselor, race to to piece together advice from the words scattered in front of you in a humorous attempt to solve the caller's problem.

The caller picks their favorite response.

For 3-4 players, the first player to be awarded five cards wins. For more than five players, the first player to be awarded three cards wins.

Name: Sabacc: Coruscant Shift
Description:
This format of Sabacc is sold exclusively aboard the Star Wars: Galactic Starcruiser at Disney's Hollywood Studios.  It uses different components and slightly different rules than the version sold in Blackspire Outpost. Like "Corellian Spike" Sabaac, the deck includes 30 green positive cards with values of 1 through 10 (3 each), 30 red negative cards with values of -1 through -10 (3 each), and two black cards with values of 0.  However, unlike that version, there are also two custom dice, one which shows suits (square, circle, triangle) and one which shows a number value (0,0,5,-5,10,-10).

The object of the game is to score as close as possible to the number rolled on the gold die.  The silver suit die is used as a tie breaker if two players have the same value.  Suit values are per card, so two triangle cards would be two triangles, no matter what the value of the card shows.

Once the dealer has rolled the dice, he deals five cards to each player.  Players then calculate their hands, and save as many cards as they would like face down.   Then the "Shift" phase occurs, which allows players to get new cards for cards they did not save, returning their hands to 5 cards.  The "Improve" step is adding newly acquired cards to their face down saved cards pile, if they wish.  The improve cards may alternatively be discarded.  Finally, players "Reveal" their face down cards to see who came closest to the dice value goal.

Betting chips are not included in the game, but a round of betting after the deal, "Shift" and "Improve" phases is assumed.  This is also how game play works in the electronic Sabacc table version you can play in the Sublight Lounge on the Galactic Starcruiser. Once all players have had a chance to deal, the game ends and the player with the most betting chips wins.

"Coruscant Shift" has also removed the hand ranking complexity of "Corellian Spike".  If two or more players have equal hands, even after the suits tie breaker, players split the pot.

There is also a Sabacc: Bounty Hunt variant included in the rules, which is similar to Go Fish for younger children.

Name: Fairy Tale Files: Sweet Witch Inferno
Description:
Fairy Land's most popular candy shop was burnt to the ground and the proprieter was found under the rubble, incinerated in the oven! Who could do such a thing? The main suspects, Hansel & Gretel, were seen at the scene of the crime but what could their motive be for such a heinous crime?

Collect the clues and solve the puzzles to find out!

The Fairy Tale Files are lighthearted murder mystery detective games inspired by iconic fairy tales. We bring  you the delight of your favorite childhood stories with an adult twist! Join the Magical Mishaps Agency to solve the clues and find the killer!

—description from the publisher
Families: Folk Tales & Fairy Tales: Hansel and Gretel

Name: Traff Park
Description:
This is a game based on the similarly named Hungarian browser Flash game. It can be found at "traff.hu", but unfortunately it has not worked since Flash Player was discontinued in 2020.

This game, like the website and books published over the years, teaches children how to drive safely on the roads.

In this game, players must be the first to get their car home after going through each station in the four corners of the game board. They roll a dice in each round to determine how much they can advance on the board by following the traffic rules. The game is hampered by certain events, such as puddles or roadblocks.

The first player to get home to the garage after washing their car, charging their battery, inflating their tires and refueling their car wins the game.

Name: KTA: Krack that auto!
Description:
Steal the cars, escape then police chasing, crash and shoot your competition to earn big cash! In this game each player takes a role of car burglar in the city where no car is safe.

The game contains two packs of cards (cars and missions), tokens (police, pistol, speed and damage), dice and figures of thieves. Game is released under Creative Commons license and is available for download, print and play.

Each player start with three random secret missions. During each player's turn one of following action can be performed: scouting (exploring) cars, stealing them, arm with firearms, ride and/or crash, shoot and accomplish a mission.

Violent actions can trigger police chasing of different levels which has to be avoided at the start of the turn by dice rolling.

First player who manage to accomplish missions worth $21.000 wins the game.

—description from the publisher

Name: Atlantic Records
Description:
A roll-and-move race from Great Britain to the United States from the golden age of parlour board games: the early 20th century.

Players are assigned a starting port and a finish port by taking a mock 'ticket'; they then proceed across the board by rolling the six-sided dice and resolving any effects of special spaces they land upon.

The board offers multiple tracks from each port. Events spaces are noted in 2 letter Morse Code abbreviations.

The first player to reach their designated destination is declared the winner!

—user summary

Name: Good Boy
Description:
In the game Good Boy  you move to the world of cheerful dogs. Here you will meet the most different breeds from around the world.

Your task is to collect toys and treats that will make dogs want to play with you. Beware, however, of devious cats that can spoil even the best fun.

The player who proves to be the dogs' best friend wins the game.

—description from the publisher (translated)
