Wasze zadanie polega na zbieraniu zabawek i Å‚akoci, dziÄ™ki którym psy bÄ™dÄ… chciaÅ‚y siÄ™ z Wami bawiÄ‡. UwaÅ¼ajcie jednak na przebiegÅ‚e koty, które mogÄ… popsuÄ‡ nawet najlepszÄ… zabawÄ™.

Gracz, który okaÅ¼e siÄ™ najwiÄ™kszym przyjacielem psiaków, wygrywa grÄ™.

—description from the publisher

Name: Magnate: The Boardgame Economy Promo
Description:
Promo created to celebrate the retail launch in Feb 2022 features a unique set of 4 new tenant cards and 8 corresponding tenant tokens with a special boardgame theme.

Tenants: Game Cafe, Game Distributor, Indie Game Publisher, Boardgamer

Name: Crime Zoom: Fenêtre sur crimes
Description:
Crime Zoom is a series of investigation game for 1 and more players and for plays of about 1 hour.

Each investigation propels you into a different universe, but almost always on a crime scene.

This crime scene is spread over several cards to form a great illustration. To investigate, nothing more simple. Take a card to take a closer look. An item intrigues you? Flip the card over and find out what is this little paper on the bedside table.

An address? You can now take the card that corresponds to this track. Unless another element on the crime scene appeals you even more ?

In Crime Zoom, you will conduct your investigation freely. Discuss between players to choose the tracks to follow. And as soon as you think you have solved the case, go to the questionnaire. Who is guilty ? What is his mobile ? What is the murder weapon ? And some subsidiary questions, of course.

Do not miss the culprit otherwise you will lose the game. But if you answer the questions correctly, the number of cards you will not reveal will decide you.

The solution will answer each of the questions. The epilogue will come to tell all this in a story or a testimony history to understand the plot that has been played.

Crime Zoom: Fenêtre sur crimes is the fifth case of the Crime Zoom family. It brings you in a residence in Los Angeles in 1954. This case is a tribute to Hitchcock famous movie Fenêtre sur cour (Rear Window).

—description from the publisher

Name: Pop-A-Tops: Match-A-Martian
Description:
Pop into the fun with Pop-A-Tops Match-A-Martian! “Roll” the dice and try to be the first one to spot the matching alien card! With Pop-A-Tops, everything fits neatly inside the container, with the dice included in the domed top. Never drop your dice again with them safely contained! Have fun giving the container a pop! to see what you roll!

—description from the publisher

On a player's turn they roll the dice which show the shape, background and color of the Martian. The first player to grab the corresponding card keeps it. The first player to grab 5th or 7th card (depending on number of players) wins the game.

—user summary

Name: Endangered: Ukrainian Ambassador Card
Description: Endangered: Ukrainian Ambassador Card is a micro-expansion for the base game. The extension introduces a new ambassador card representing Ukraine and specifies a new equation to make that ambassador's vote favorable.

Name: BattleTech: Shrapnel Magazine – Issue 8
Description:
Shrapnel: The Official BattleTech Magazine delivers tales of tragedy and triumph amid the struggles of BattleMechs on the battlefields of the 31st century and beyond! A spurned Solaris gladiator enacts a unique brand of payback. A Federated Suns mission to take down the infamous “Lady Death” Trevaline runs afoul of pirate ingenuity. A ex-mercenary on Outreach must risk everything during the Fourth Succession War to protect those who cannot protect themselves. In this issue, you’ll venture into the jungles and avoid native predators while racing to recover lost Star League-era data; discover the truth lurking behind a seemingly unbeatable Word of Blake ’Mech; and fight to preserve a MechWarrior’s right to crack open a cold, frosty beverage after the battle is done. Then return to the shadows and danger of the Game World with the penultimate part of our Solaris VII serial.

Contains Rules for:

     TRO Executioner B
     Unit Digest - First Augustine Arquebusiers
     Campaign - A Short Stop in Astrokazy

Name: Pop-A-Tops: Bake-A-Cake
Description:
Pop the top to “roll” the dice! Race to collect and match the cake topping card to build your cupcake!

Assemble your cupcake in order by colour, case, cake, icing and cherry. The case colour determines the cupcake you make. Keep an eye out for your colour! If you roll the ‘swap’ arrows, you can swap cakes with the opponent of your choice.

If you roll the Cake Monster’s mouth your cake is guzzled and its back to the start! The player who creates the perfect cupcake first wins!

— description from the publisher

On a player's turn they roll the dice which show a shape and a color of the part of the cake. Immediately each player has to grab the corresponding tile. The colors of the tiles are hidden because the tiles lay face down, so at first no one knows which is correct. But during the game players can memorize which tiles lay where. The dice also show two special effect, one of each orders the active player to return particular piece, while another allow players to steal from others. The first player to collect 3 different pieces of a cupcake wins the game.

— user summary

Name: Pop-A-Tops: Pet Factor
Description:
Pop the top to “roll” the dice and choose the category, then race to collect the cute animal piece you think will score highest!

The player with the highest score that matches the dice roll keeps the card. Player who collects the most cards at the end wins!

Which adorable pet is the cutest, cuddliest, biggest, rarest or the most famous?

— description from the publisher

On a player's turn they roll the die which shows a category (cuteness, cudliness, size, rarity, fame, player's chioce). Immediately each player has to grab a pet with the highest value of the indicated parameter. When each player grabs one card, they flip them and chech the value. The player that chose the best pet keeps the card. The first player to keep 5 or 7 cards (depending on the number of players) wins the game.

— user summary

Name: Deception/CS-Files: Greek Promo Pack
Description:
A new promo pack with eight new Greek Themed clue cards and eight new means cards.

Greek Salad
Bougatsa
Fireplace
Odyssey & Iliad (Homer)
Airline Tickets
Greek Souvenir
Pita Gyros
Ouzo

Animal Trophy
Jellyfish
Band Saw
Fishing Net
Manhole
Procrustean Bed
Golden Larnax
Scaffolding

Name: Quilters
Description:
In this tile laying game players are fighting over who can make the best quilt. Every round there will be a set number of tiles that players will draft, placing them on their own quilt.  At the end of each round players will compare groupings of the different colors in the hope of getting stars that will give them points that they will need to win the game. However, be careful, as you must place your stars on top of squares that break will break up your groupings.

The game ends after a set number of rounds (4/3/4), and at that point players score points for their stars and for the shape of their quilt. The player with the most points will be crowned the victor. Quilting has never been this competitive!

Name: World Challenge Game
Description:
The first board game that rewards your knowledge!

World Challenge Game is a game where all players will answer questions and will conquer countries simultaneously. Depending on the chosen game mode "Conqueror or Attack" the game will end sooner or later. Fight to conquer the world and show that you are the one who knows the most! Answer questions, think carefully about the territories you want to conquer and learn while you prove that you are the best in World Challenge Game.
 Choose one of two game modes:

- Conqueror, where you conquer as many countries as possible before the end of the game or Raid, where you attack and win the countries conquered by other players to take over the entire continent. In this mode you can conquer a country that another player has won.

On each turn, a player will take a card and choose one of the two existing questions, which they must read aloud, along with the four answers. The other participants will write on their card the answer which they consider correct, marking an "X" in the options A, B, C or D. When everyone has answered the question, the answers will be revealed, starting with the player to the left of the one who read the question. If the answer is correct, the player can place a conquest token in an available border country and the same for the rest of the players.

The Conqueror game will automatically end once the last country on the continent is conquered. At that time, the countries that each player has conquered will be counted, so the player with the most countries conquered will be the winner of the game. If there are two or more players who have the same maximum number of conquered countries, questions will be read to them as a tiebreaker. Players who cannot answer the question lose.

- The Attack game will end when there is only one player left on the continent and they will be crowned the winner. If the question cards run out, the game would end and the one with the most countries would win. There is also the option in case you want to continue the game, you can use the questions available in the APP, choosing the "Board game questions" section.

—description from the publisher

Name: Wordy Laundry
Description:
In this groovy tug-of-words game, players push and pull 1970s laundry items (letter cards) on clotheslines to form words and score points. Spell words on the line to earn instant points (Pegs), then organize laundry in your Laundry Basket for game-end bonuses. To win, score the most points by the time the game ends.

- Manage a Hand of Laundry (letter) cards - Each card is worth 1-4 Pegs (points), and has 1 of 6 funky patterns. Decide exactly when to hang each item, and when to collect it. Watch out for neighbors (and windy weather), which may snatch up desirable cards before you can.

- Use Action Points to hang, push, pull, remove, and collect cards.

- Spell Words by arranging letters on the Clothesline.

- Collect Funky Patterns in your Laundry Basket to score game-end bonuses. Collect 4 of the same patterns or 4 different patterns in each column to maximize your points.

Race to fill your Laundry Basket and trigger the end of the game. Then add together your in-game points and game-end bonuses. The player with the most points wins.

Name: Village Pillage: Robbin' Hood
Description:
Your village is bursting with turnips! Enough for every man, woman, and wall to enjoy all the root vegetables they can eat.

But wealth brings a class divide – grasping nobles, thieving raiders, and freeholding farmers, stuck in the middle.
Worst of all, wealth has also come to those horrible OTHER villages! There’s only one man who can stop them: he robs from the rich and steals from the poor – it’s Robbin’ Hood, with his merry band of scoundrels, rapscallions, and turnip-thieves!

Hire outlaws, steal from your neighbors, and do everything in your power to avoid paying the corrupt Sheriff her weight in turnip-tax.

Robbin’ Hood is a brand new expansion for Village Pillage, featuring a brand new rich/poor mechanic and more turnip-stealing than ever before! More than a dozen new cards, designed to shake up your games and bamboozle your neighbors.

A neighbor is rich if they have more turnips than you, and poor if they have fewer. Cards marked with an arrow trigger after other cards of their type; time your Merry Men carefully, to steal as many juicy turnips as you can!
Families: Folk Tales & Fairy Tales: Robin Hood

Name: Magic: The Gathering — Commander 2021: Strixhaven Commander — Prismari Performance Deck
Description:
This preconstructed commander deck is part of the Commander 2021 set. It is a blue-red deck with an instants and sorceries theme, featuring Zaffai, Thunder Conductor as the face commander. Each of the five Commander 2021 decks ties into one of the five colleges featured in Strixhaven: School of Mages; "Prismari Performance" is based on Prismari College.

This deck contains 100 cards, 10 double-sided tokens, 1 display commander, 1 life wheel, and 1 cardstock deck box.

Name: Village of Legends: Adhara
Description:
This new expansion is easy to learn and features new adventures, heroes,  cards, and tokens.

As well as a lot of new material that can be used in the classic competitive version, with this new box you will have also the opportunity to create a party and set out to discover new mysteries and face incredible beasts in the cooperative mode.

The beautifully illustrated Adventure Book with unique illustrations by Lorenzo Lupi is also included in this expansion box.

Name: Magic: The Gathering — Commander 2021: Strixhaven Commander — Witherbloom Witchcraft Deck
Description:
This preconstructed commander deck is part of the Commander 2021 set. It is a black-green deck with a life-gain and life payment theme, featuring Willowdusk, Essence Seer as the face commander. Each of the five Commander 2021 decks ties into one of the five colleges featured in Strixhaven: School of Mages; "Witherbloom Witchcraft" is based on Witherbloom College.

This deck contains 100 cards, 10 double-sided tokens, 1 display commander, 1 life wheel, and 1 cardstock deck box.

Name: Magic: The Gathering – Commander 2021: Strixhaven Commander – Lorehold Legacies Deck
Description:
This preconstructed commander deck is part of the Commander 2021 set. It is a red-white deck with an artifact theme, featuring Osgir, the Reconstructor as the face commander. Each of the five Commander 2021 decks ties into one of the five colleges featured in Strixhaven: School of Mages; "Lorehold Legacies" is based on Lorehold College.

This deck contains 100 cards, 10 double-sided tokens, 1 display commander, 1 life wheel, and 1 cardstock deck box.

Name: Magic: The Gathering — Commander 2021: Strixhaven Commander — Quantum Quandrix Deck
Description:
This preconstructed commander deck is part of the Commander 2021 set. It is a blue-green deck with a creature token theme, featuring Adrix and Nev, Twincasters as the face commander. Each of the five Commander 2021 decks ties into one of the five colleges featured in Strixhaven: School of Mages; "Quantum Quandrix" is based on Quandrix College.

This deck contains 100 cards, 10 double-sided tokens, 1 display commander, 1 life wheel, and 1 cardstock deck box.
